column4: what is it with linux firefox? when some pages load it just hangs for 5-10 seconds...
could be parsing the page
yeah, probably. no other tabs can be accessed in the meantime.
what do you mean by talking?
ping/ssh etc etc ;)
both the 192.168.2.x and 192.168.1.y networks can use the internet through the routerbox, but they just cannot access eachother
let me get this straight. you have connected two networks to the same router.  the router gives IP to network 1 automaticly through dhcp and the other one is static that uses the router as a gateway?
yeah that's about it ;) (the ...162.2.x is dhcp and 1 is static... ) and the router is actually a debian-serverinstall
and ideas about my network nightmare? ;)
i am thinking
i would guess that you need to set up a static route. i *think* the command goes something like : route add -host 192.168.2.x gw 192.168.1.x
hang on, i saw a good url somewhere
mmh, i tried setting up a route but the way i did it didnt work.. i'll hold ;)
did you try the "net" option as well? route add -net 192.168.2.0 netmask 255.255.255.0 gw 192.168.1.10
ah, here it is: http://www.aboutdebian.com/network.htm explains static routing as well
ty, will look into that later =)
np
